mdRecord.dcterms:title: Piedmont, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Maury, Reuben (American farmer and carpenter, 1785-1869) [builder]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Side with view of icehouse and 1959 faculty housing

Piedmont was the nineteenth-century seat of the Maury family. The south wing of the present house is the earliest component and may have been constructed about 1806 by Reuben Maury, a carpenter. Wings and other additions ca. 1830-ca. 1860 and 1938. The property originally included the present house, its adjoining outbuilding, a barn and a cemetery. The University acquired the property in 1942. -- UVa Office of the Architect Report [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
